title: I'm 15 and I don't want to go back to school. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: You might have no choice, if where you live there’s a mandatory schooling requirement, and most developed countries have it until age 16 or so. You really should get your high school diploma somehow, but you don’t necessarily have to go to the same school you’ve been going to, or you can also look into home schooling. If you hate your school, I think you really need to get out of there at all costs. Force your parents to find a better school for you or get you into home schooling. You can refuse to go to school and force them to find a solution to your problems. Good luck.

That's an easy question. Go back to school. I know it must be hard for you. You are going to need some of the things they teach at your grade level. You could get yourself and your parents in trouble with the law. The schools in America are a shambles. But since you can't legally make the choice till you're 18, you are kinda stuck. This is a life lesson for you. Sometimes you have to do what others want you to do.
